Solve the trigonometric expression: 

sin²(x) + cos²(x) - 2sin(x)cos(x) when x is equal to 30 degrees.
message_2:
To solve the trigonometric expression when x is equal to 30 degrees, we first need to find the sine and cosine values for 30 degrees. 

sin(30°) = 1/2
cos(30°) = √3/2

Now, we can plug these values into the expression:

sin²(x) + cos²(x) - 2sin(x)cos(x) = (1/2)² + (√3/2)² - 2(1/2)(√3/2)

= 1/4 + 3/4 - (√3/2)

= 1 - (√3/2)

So, the value of the trigonometric expression when x is equal to 30 degrees is 1 - (√3/2).
